PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 364, 314]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 2 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 278, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/32 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 299, 905, 314]]<|/det|> May/June 2017 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 320, 905, 335]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 584, 375]]<|/det|> Additional Materials: As listed in the Confidential Instructions. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|> ## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 447]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 447, 504, 462]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 504, 477]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 476, 380, 491]]<|/det|> DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 502, 273, 517]]<|/det|> Answer both questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 516, 780, 532]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of one hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 531, 905, 560]]<|/det|> You are expected to record all your observations as soon as these observations are made, and to plan the presentation of the records so that it is not necessary to make a fair copy of them. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 740, 574]]<|/det|> You are reminded of the need for good English and clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 358, 600]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 767, 615]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 624, 806, 641]]<|/det|> Additional answer paper and graph paper should be used only if it becomes necessary to do so. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 604, 666]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 758, 681]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 700, 905, 848]]<|/det|>
For Examiner's Use
1
2
Total

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 71, 717, 89]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 99, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 598, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate an electrical circuit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 133, 185, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[198, 133, 514, 152]]<|/det|>
Assemble the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 173, 803, 406]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 438, 510, 457]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 470, 450, 488]]<|/det|>
The two resistors are identical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 485, 650, 504]]<|/det|>
A, B and C are crocodile clips. Connect C to the screw.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 517, 183, 536]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 517, 875, 551]]<|/det|>
Connect A to the wire at a distance \(p\) of approximately \(25\mathrm{cm}\) from the screw, as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 562, 181, 581]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 562, 339, 581]]<|/det|>
Close the switch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 873, 107]]<|/det|>
Change \(p\) and repeat (a)(iii), (a)(iv), (a)(v) and (a)(vi) until you have six sets of values of \(p\), \(q\) and \(V\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 405, 121]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 487, 147]]<|/det|>
Include values of \(\frac{1}{p}\) and \(\frac{1}{q}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 560, 876, 579]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 588, 144, 607]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 587, 175, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 584, 650, 612]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{q}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{p}\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 588, 876, 607]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 619, 180, 637]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 618, 457, 637]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 618, 876, 637]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 650, 181, 669]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 650, 608, 669]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[489, 871, 871, 892]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 903, 871, 922]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 920, 875, 937]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 724, 92]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that the quantities \(q\) and \(p\) are related by the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 109, 520, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{q} = \frac{a}{p} +b\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 398, 182]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 672, 214]]<|/det|>
Use your answers in **(c)**(iii) to determine the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 211, 346, 229]]<|/det|>
Give appropriate units.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 863, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the rotational oscillation of a combination of springs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 144, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 180, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 133, 875, 167]]<|/det|>
You are provided with two joined springs and three joined springs. Using the **two** joined springs, set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 178, 836, 495]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 516, 510, 535]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 549, 181, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 549, 875, 584]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the height \(h_{1}\) of the bottom of the mass hanger above the bench, as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[539, 610, 876, 630]]<|/det|>
<form>\(h_{1} =\) ................................................. m [1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 588, 945, 628]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 643, 181, 661]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 643, 875, 676]]<|/det|>
Add the \(100\mathrm{g}\) mass to the mass hanger. Measure and record the height \(h_{2}\) of the bottom of the mass hanger above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[539, 702, 876, 722]]<|/det|>
<form>\(h_{2} =\) ................................................. m [1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 682, 945, 721]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 736, 181, 754]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 736, 655, 754]]<|/det|>
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(h_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[369, 892, 876, 911]]<|/det|>
<form>percentage uncertainty = ................................................. [1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 870, 945, 907]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 180, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 794, 92]]<|/det|>
Calculate the spring constant \(k\) for the combination, using the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 109, 532, 144]]<|/det|>
\[k = \frac{mg}{(h_1 - h_2)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 163, 524, 183]]<|/det|>
where \(m = 0.100 \text{kg}\) and \(g = 9.81 \text{N} \text{kg}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[510, 303, 876, 323]]<|/det|>
<form>k = .................................................... N m⁻¹ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 335, 181, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 335, 806, 355]]<|/det|>
